Pengakuan Ayah Tiri Aniaya Balita Hingga Tewas
01 Nov 2019, 12:29 by Hanum Oktavia


Pengakuan Ayah Tiri Aniaya Balita Hingga Tewas

KBRN, Malang: Kejadian naas dialami Agnes Arnelita, balita tiga tahun di Kota Malang. Ia tewas setelah dianiaya oleh Ery Age Anwar (36) yang merupakan ayah tirinya. Agnes meninggal dengan luka lebam di sekujur tubuhnya, luka bakar di kakinya. Bahkan berdasarkan hasil autopsi, usus besar korban mengalami robek akibat penganiayaan yang dilakukan tersangka. Penganiayaan ini dilakukan Ery karena jengkel pada korban. 
“Motifnya karena jengkel, dia sering Buang Air Besar (BAB) dan buang air kecil sembarangan,” kata Ery saat ditemui wartawan di Mapolres Malang Kota, Jumat (01/11/2019).
Dari hasil keterangan saksi yang merupakan keluarga korban, Agnes sempat mengaku bahwa sering mendapatkan tindakan kekerasan dari ayah tirinya. Ditanya soal kebenaran hal itu, Ery mengaku memang sering mencubit korban. “Kalau memukuli jarang, tapi sering cubit lengan dan paha,” ungkap Ery yang saat itu mengenakan baju tahanan oranye.
Ditanya mengapa ia tega menganiaya anak tirinya hingga tewas, Ery tida menjawab, hanya tertunduk sambil tangannya diborgol. 
Kasat Reskrim Polres Malang Kota, AKP Komang Yogi Arya Wiguna mengungkapkan, jika tindakan kekerasan yang dialami Agnes dilakukan ketika ibu kandung korban, Hermin sedang bekerja di luar rumah sebagai Marketing perumahan. “Otomatis yang mengasuh anaknya adalah ayah tirinya, karena ibunya bekerja. Sedangkan pelaku pekerjaannya serabutan,” ujarnya.
Kejadian itu dilakukan di rumah kontrakannya yang berada di kawasan Perumahan Tlogowaru Indah, Kota Malang. “Keluarga ini baru empat bulan mengontrak rumah disitu. Memang pindah-pindah kontrakan,” tutur Komang.
Dari hasil penyelidikan, diketahui Ery dan istrinya Hermin tinggal di rumah itu tanpa ikatan. Selain sang korban Agnes, keduanya juga memiliki seorang bayi berumur 1,5 bulan. “Bahkan keluarga istri tidak tahu kalau selama ini kumpul dengan tersangka dan punya anak,” imbuhnya.
Saat ini, status Hermin sebagai istri tersangka dan imbau kandung korban masih sebagai saksi. Namun polisi melakukan pendalaman terkait dugaan Hermin turut mendukung perbuatan tersangka. “Masih kita dalam apakah memang ada tindakan seperti itu (melindungi) dari pihak istrinya. Yang jelas saat ini statusnya masih saksi,” pungkasnya. 
Seperti diberitakan sebelumnya, Seorang pria bernama Ery Age Anwar tega menganiaya Agnes Arnelita, balita berusia tiga tahun hingga tewas. Ironisnya, Ery merupakan ayah tiri korban. Jika sebelumnya tersangka mengakui bahwa anaknya meninggal akibat tenggelam di kamar mandi, namun akhirnya ia mengaku telah melakukan penganiayaan hingga Agnes meninggal.
Hal itu terungkap setelah kepolisian melakukan autopsi pada jenazah korban. Dari Hadi autopsi tersebut, ditemukan sejumlah luka lebam, luka bakar, dan kerusakan jaringan dalam tubuh berupa pendarahan akibat usus besar yang robek. Kini, Ery harus mendekam di jeruji besi tahanan Polres Malang Kota untuk mempertanggungjawabkan perbuatannya.

Stepfather's Confession of Toddler Abuse to Death
Nov 01 2019, 12:29 p.m. by Hanum Oktavia


Stepfather's Confession of Toddler Abuse to Death

KBRN, Malang: The unfortunate event experienced by Agnes Arnelita, a three-year-old toddler in Malang. He died after being persecuted by Ery Age Anwar (36) who is his stepfather. Agnes died with bruises all over her body, burns on her legs. Even based on the results of the autopsy, the victim's large intestine was torn due to mistreatment by the suspect. The persecution was carried out by Ery because he was annoyed with the victim.
"His motives are annoyed, he often defecates (defecates) and urinates carelessly," Ery said when met by reporters at Malang City Police Headquarters, Friday (01/11/2019).
From the testimony of witnesses who were the victim's family, Agnes had admitted that she often received acts of violence from her stepfather. Asked about the truth of that matter, Ery admitted that he often pinched victims. "If you beat up rarely, but often pinch your arms and thighs," said Ery who was wearing an orange prisoner.
Asked why he had the heart to torture his stepson to death, Ery answered, only bowing while his hands were handcuffed.
Head of Criminal Investigation Unit of Malang City Police, AKP Komang Yogi Arya Wiguna revealed, if the act of violence that Agnes experienced was carried out when the victim's biological mother, Hermin was working outside the home as a housing marketing. "Automatically raising his child is his stepfather, because his mother works. While the perpetrators of their jobs odd jobs, "he said.
The incident was carried out at his rented house in the Tlogowaru Indah housing area, Malang City. "This family has only rented a house for four months. Indeed, they move from a rented house, "said Komang.
From the results of the investigation, it is known that Ery and his wife Hermin lived in the house without ties. In addition to the victim Agnes, both of them also have a 1.5 month old baby. "Even the wife's family does not know that all this time they have gathered with a suspect and have children," he added.
At present, Hermin's status as the suspect's wife and the victim's biological appeal are still witnesses. But the police made a deepening related to Hermin's alleged involvement in supporting the suspect's actions. "We are still in whether there is such an action (protecting) from his wife's side. What is clear is that the status is still a witness, "he concluded.
As reported earlier, a man named Ery Age Anwar could torture Agnes Arnelita, a three-year-old toddler to death. Ironically, Ery is the victim's stepfather. If the suspect had previously admitted that his son died from drowning in the bathroom, but finally he claimed to have committed persecution until Agnes died.
This was revealed after the police conducted an autopsy on the victim's body. From the autopsy Hadi, found a number of bruises, burns, and tissue damage in the body in the form of bleeding due to a torn colon. Now, Ery must languish in the iron bars of Malang City Police prisoners to take responsibility for his actions.
